sentence.Network_en: You write very movingly of your sister Amy's suicide.
sentence.Network_cn: 你对你妹妹埃米的自杀描写很是让人伤感。

entry.tran: 感人的;令人感伤（或同情）的
entry.def: If something is moving, it makes you feel strongly an emotion such as sadness, pity, or sympathy.

example.ex: It is very moving to see how much strangers can care for each other...
example.tran: 看到陌生人之间这般彼此关照，实在令人感动。

example.ex: It was a moving moment for Marianne.
example.tran: 对玛丽安娜来说，那是动人的一刻。

entry.tran: (模型或机器部件)活动的，可移动的
entry.def: A moving model or part of a machine moves or is able to move.

entry.tran: 推动力；起激励作用的人(或事)
entry.def: The moving spirit or moving force behind something is the person or thing that caused it to start and to keep going, or that influenced people to take part in it.

example.ex: She alone must have been the moving spirit behind the lawsuit that lost me my position...
example.tran: 肯定是她一个人主使了让我丢掉职位的诉讼。

example.ex: Professor Krauss has been a moving force in the world of academic art criticism.
example.tran: 克劳斯教授已成为学院艺术批评界的领军人物。
